Rule: Classes that have name matching "Dao" should reside in a package "..dao..".
DictoDSL:
DaoClass: Class with name="*Dao*"
DaoPkg: Class with package="..dao.."
DaoClass must ResideIn(DaoPkg)

Rule: Classes that in "..dao.." should access Classes that are Assignable to "EntityManager.class"
DictoDSL:
DaoPkg: Class with package="..dao.."
EntityMgr: Class with name="EntityManager"
DaoPkg must Access(EntityMgr)
Notes: AssignableTo(EntityManager) uses type-level semantics; Dicto lacks a native type system; this expression suffers from severe semantic loss.

Rule: Classes that are public should not depend on classes that residing in package "..service..".
Classes that are public should not depend on classes that are assignable to "EntityManager".
Classes that in the "..impl.." package should not be interfaces.
Notes: Dicto does not distinguish between interface/class kind.

Rule: Classes residing in the "..persistence.." package should not access any classes in the "..service.." package.
DictoDSL:
Persistence: Class with package="..persistence.."
Service: Class with package="..service.."
Persistence cannot Access(Service)

Rule: Classes in the "..service.." package should only be accessed by classes in the "..controller.." or "..service.." packages
DictoDSL:
Service: Class with package="..service.."
Controller: Class with package="..controller.."
Service must BeAccessedBy(Controller)
Service must BeAccessedBy(Service)
Notes: Dicto has no only/closed-world semantics; it cannot prevent access from other packages.

Rule: Classes in the "..service.." package should access classes that in "..service..", "..persistence..", or "java.." package.
Notes: Dicto can write to multiple Access objects, but it cannot block other access targets.

Rule: Classes in the "..service.." package should not depend on classes in the "..controller.." package
DictoDSL:
Service: Class with package="..service.."
Controller: Class with package="..controller.."
Service cannot DependOn(Controller)

Rule: Classes in the "..service.." package should only have dependent classes in the "..controller.." or "..service.." packages.
Classes in the "..service.." package should only depend on classes in "..service..", "..persistence..", "java..", or "javax.." packages
Classes that In "..service.." package should not depend on classes that in package "..persistence.."
DictoDSL:
Service: Class with package="..service.."
Persistence: Class with package="..persistence.."
Service cannot DependOn(Persistence)

Rule: Classes that In package "..service.." should only depend on classes that in package "..persistence.." and "..controller.."
Notes: Dicto's ability to have no closed dependency domain

Rule: Classes that have name matching "Dao" should only depend on classes that in a package "..dao..".
Notes: Dicto's ability to have no closed dependency domain

Rule: No class should depend on an upper package.
DictoDSL:
LowerClass: Class with package="com.company.util.helper.*"
UpperPackage: Package with name="com.company.util"
LowerClass cannot DependOn(UpperPackage)
Notes: Dicto cannot represent a collection of classes; it can be expressed using specific class names or package names.
